meanings.definition: The fourth letter of the Hebrew alphabet.
meanings.sent1: In Hebrew, daleth is the fourth letter of the alphabet.
meanings.sent2: Children learning Hebrew often start with daleth.
meanings.sent3: The daleth on the page looked like a little house.
meanings.sent4: His name was written in daleth, symbolizing his fourth place.
meanings.sent5: The daleth stood out on the page, bold and clear.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Hebrew script.
meanings.sent1: The ancient scribe used daleth in his script.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study the intricacies of daleth in ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The daleth script was beautifully preserved on the scroll.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace was engraved with delicate daleth characters.
meanings.sent5: The daleth script was a key to unlocking the ancient text.

meanings.definition: A symbol representing the number four.
meanings.sent1: The daleth symbolized the number four in the ancient system.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, daleth is used to represent the number 4.
meanings.sent3: The daleth on the dice landed facing up, showing four dots.
meanings.sent4: The daleth was etched on the stone tablet, denoting the number four.
meanings.sent5: The daleth symbol was a clear indicator of the quantity four.
